dialogues.speaker: Leon
dialogues.message: Master Agnus, I have returned with the scroll I found in the mad wizard's lair.

dialogues.speaker: Agnus
dialogues.message: Ah, Leon. You've done well to retrieve it. Let me see...

dialogues.speaker: Agnus
dialogues.message: (Agnus examines the scroll, his brow furrowing in concern.)

dialogues.speaker: Agnus
dialogues.message: This is indeed the scroll Velius used to raise the dead. But as I feared, it is torn, missing a crucial part.

dialogues.speaker: Leon
dialogues.message: Missing a part? But what does that mean, Master Agnus?

dialogues.speaker: Agnus
dialogues.message: It means that the information needed to lift the curse, to undo Velius' dark magic, lies within the missing portion. Without it, we cannot hope to banish the darkness that plagues Sylvanleaf Haven.

dialogues.speaker: Leon
dialogues.message: And where is this missing part, Master Agnus? Can it be found within the cave?

dialogues.speaker: Agnus
dialogues.message: No, Leon. Velius holds the missing part. It is in his possession, guarded by his malevolent will.

dialogues.speaker: Leon
dialogues.message: Then defeating Velius is the only way to obtain it. I must confront him and put an end to his reign of terror.

dialogues.speaker: Agnus
dialogues.message: Yes, Leon. The fate of our village rests upon your shoulders. But remember, Velius is a formidable foe. Prepare yourself well before facing him. Seek allies, gather strength, and when you are ready, confront him with all the courage and determination you possess.

dialogues.speaker: Leon
dialogues.message: I will not fail, Master Agnus. Velius will answer for his crimes, and Sylvanleaf Haven will be free once more.

dialogues.speaker: Agnus
dialogues.message: Go forth, Leon. Once you defeat Velius come meet me at the altar of gods with the missing part of the scroll. Iâ€™ll perform the Ritual to lift this curse once and for all.
